issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
When I edit Wikidata schema in the language setting of Japanese, any property cannot be suggested.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Language Settings'
2. Choose '日本語' and click 'Change Language'
3. Click on 'クリップボード' (= 'Clipboard')
4. Follow the instruction explained at [this tutorial](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Tools/OpenRefine/Editing/Tutorials/Inverse_Listeria).
5. When typing in 'patronage' as a property of a statement, you see nothing is suggested.
Even if you type in '利用者数', a Japanese label of the patronage property ([P3872](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Property:P3872)), the result doesn't change.

**Current Results**
Nothing suggested.
If I type in 'P3872', OpenRefine suggests 'SPARQL: P3872', which might work properly, but it is not helpful for human.

**Expected behavior**
OpenRefine is expected to suggest properties as in the language setting of English.

issues.title: Fetching from URL: Crossref reports "HTTP error 401" (no authorization required)
issues.body:
**Describe the bug** When fetching a URL from Crossref the API returns "HTTP error 401 : Unauthorized (...)". The Crossref API does not require an authorization (cf. https://www.crossref.org/services/metadata-delivery/rest-api-users/) though. API call worked fine in OR 2.8 + 3.0 beta until June 21st 2018. Error first occured on June 25th. Contacted Crossref Support June 26th – they cannot identify error on their side. They told us to look into this further, status unclear at the moment **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create Column 'DOI' (example value: `10.1016/j.csndt.2016.09.002`) 2. Edit Column -> Add column by fetching URLs 3. Leave Default Language (GREL) + Add 'Expression': `"http://api.crossref.org/works/" + value` 4. See error **Current Results** `HTTP error 401 : Unauthorized |

401 Unauthorized

You need a valid user and password to access this content. ` **Expected behavior** return Crossref Metadata in JSON format **Desktop (please complete the following information):** tested on different systems with both OR 2.8 and 3.0 – latest systems were: 1. Windows - Windows 10 - Chrome 67 2. Mac - OSX 10.10.5 - Chrome 65.0... **OpenRefine (please complete the following information):** - OpenRefine 3.0 Beta **Datasets** some example DOIs: 10.1103/physrevb.96.041124 10.1103/physreve.95.052419 10.1155/2017/6820482 **Additional context** Workaround for this problem: API call in Jython returns the expected data in JSON format Steps to workaround this behavior: 1. Create Column 'DOI' (example value: 10.1016/j.csndt.2016.09.002) 2. Edit Column -> Add column based on this column 3. Change Language: Python / Jython 3. Add 'Expression': ``` import urllib2 url = 'http://api.crossref.org/works/' + value response = urllib2.urlopen(url) json = response.read() json = str(json) return json ``` 4. See JSON Data from Crossref :)

issues.title: The column selection window of "Transform all" incorrectly labeled "SQL exporter"
issues.body:
When reporting a bug please provide the following information to help reproduce the bug:

#### Version of OpenRefine used (Google Refine 2.6, OpenRefine2.8, an other distribution?):
Version 3 beta

#### Operating Systems and version:
Windows 10

#### Browser + version used - Please note that OpenRefine doesn't support Internet Explorer but works OK in most cases:
All

#### Steps followed to create the issue:
Click on "All", then "Transform", then "OK"

#### If you are allowed and are OK with making your data public, it would be awesome if you can include the data causing the issue or a URL pointing to where the data is (if your concerned about keeping your data private, ping us on our mailing list):
Any dataset

#### Current Results:
![screenshot-127 0 0 1-3333-2018 06 19-12-04-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6286410/41591108-2252eb56-73b9-11e8-8b03-6e77a6828338.png)


#### Expected Results:
A column selection window labeld "Select the columns to transform", something like that.

#### Set up

OpenRefine 3.0-beta
ubuntu 16.04 
Chromium Version 66.0.3359.181 (Official Build) Built on Ubuntu , running on Ubuntu 16.04 (64-bit)


#### Steps followed to create the issue:


[Download the dataset Donavan-A75335 ](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B43bFBSY0ET3VkttWnlzQ05IaDQ )
Apply the operation Text transform in column `AMOUNT_70: value.toNumber()`
Create a text facet and try to edit one number (see screenshot)

![jsonarray 0 not a string](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2589584/40994813-4ac0311e-68cb-11e8-978a-2135e7097919.png)

OpenRefine return the following error message: `JSONArray[0] not a string.`

Tested the same process with 2.8 without issue.

issues.body: When reporting a bug please provide the following information to help reproduce the bug: #### Version of OpenRefine used (Google Refine 2.6, OpenRefine2.8, an other distribution?): Comparing master+wikidata extesion with OR 2.8 #### Steps followed to create the issue: Another date issue I'm afraid. Not sure if this is related to general date handling or something about the wikidata extension - not had a chance to look yet. Using the code from master branch + wikidata extension Adding a column using "Add columns from reconciled values" with a date type (e.g. 'date of birth'). #### Current Results: The retrieved date is not identified as a 'date' type in OR but rather as a 'Java.time.OffsetDateTime' however, then opening the same project (no changes) in OR2.8 the same cell shows correctly as 'date' type In addition this seems to stop date based functions working on the value in master branch: But the same function works fine in 2.8 #### Expected Results: Expect the data to register as a 'date' type, and for date functions to work as in 2.8

#### Personal comment

By the way, there is no importer for the N-triple format. Is there nowadays no Java library ([RDF4j](http://rdf4j.org/download/) ? ) that can guess and parse all RDF serializations (Turtle, RDF / XML, N-Triple, JSON-LD, RDF / JSON, TriG, NQuads, TriX ...) without having to create a specific importer for each one?

-----
Trunk

-----
Windows 10

Browser + version used - Please note that OpenRefine doesn't support Internet Explorer but works OK in most cases:
-----

start OpenRefine

issues.title: JSON deserialization exception due to the upgrade of org.json library in data package PR
issues.body:
Yet another bug introduced by the data package PR:

OpenRefine is now unable to deserialize its own StandardReconConfig from JSON:
```
16:14:54.821 [             recon-config] Reconstruct failed (84ms)
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.google.refine.model.recon.ReconConfig.reconstruct(ReconConfig.java:100)
	at com.google.refine.operations.recon.ReconOperation.reconstruct(ReconOperation.java:82)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.google.refine.operations.OperationRegistry.reconstruct(OperationRegistry.java:83)
	at com.google.refine.history.HistoryEntry.load(HistoryEntry.java:165)
	at com.google.refine.history.History.load(History.java:314)
	at com.google.refine.model.Project.loadFromReader(Project.java:210)
	at com.google.refine.model.Project.loadFromInputStream(Project.java:180)
	at com.google.refine.io.ProjectUtilities.loadFromFile(ProjectUtilities.java:187)
	at com.google.refine.io.ProjectUtilities.loadDataFile(ProjectUtilities.java:123)
	at com.google.refine.io.ProjectUtilities.load(ProjectUtilities.java:135)
	at com.google.refine.io.FileProjectManager.loadProject(FileProjectManager.java:258)
	at com.google.refine.ProjectManager.getProject(ProjectManager.java:507)
	at com.google.refine.commands.Command.getProject(Command.java:181)
	at com.google.refine.commands.project.GetProjectMetadataCommand.doGet(GetProjectMetadataCommand.java:56)
	at com.google.refine.RefineServlet.service(RefineServlet.java:171)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:511)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1166)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.UserAgentFilter.doFilter(UserAgentFilter.java:81)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.GzipFilter.doFilter(GzipFilter.java:132)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1157)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.handle(ServletHandler.java:388)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.security.SecurityHandler.handle(SecurityHandler.java:216)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.SessionHandler.handle(SessionHandler.java:182)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandler.handle(ContextHandler.java:765)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext.handle(WebAppContext.java:418)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:152)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.Server.handle(Server.java:326)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handleRequest(HttpConnection.java:542)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection$RequestHandler.headerComplete(HttpConnection.java:923)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseNext(HttpParser.java:547)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseAvailable(HttpParser.java:212)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:404)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.bio.SocketConnector$Connection.run(SocketConnector.java:228)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: org.json.JSONException: JSONObject["limit"] not a string.
	at org.json.JSONObject.getString(JSONObject.java:721)
	at com.google.refine.model.recon.StandardReconConfig.reconstruct(StandardReconConfig.java:115)

```

This happens even without having to switch versions: create a project with the master version, reconcile a column to wikidata, and reopen this project with the master version: you will get this bug. This is because the `org.json` library was updated to a newer version, which changes the behaviour of `JSONObject.getString`, which fails if the target value is not a `String` (whereas it used to convert it silently to a string before).

This is a big issue: it means the same problem could happen potentially in any class that deserializes numbers. This confirms the concern I had when reviewing the PR: updates of libraries are important changes that need to be discussed in their own PRs. The Data Package PR has introduced many serious bugs (see #1509). I suspect it is also the cause of #1508.

@jackyq2015 we need to consider reverting that PR.

issues.title: NullPointerException when importing an XML file due to the Data Package integration
issues.body:
When importing an XML file with OpenRefine (master branch, https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/commit/ad06d4c7a3b2ea53d8b302f4c758fac1d991146c), I get the following exception:

```
10:18:55.608 [                   refine] POST /command/core/importing-controller (18765ms)
Exception in thread "Thread-6" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at io.frictionlessdata.tableschema.TypeInferrer.infer(TypeInferrer.java:161)
	at com.google.refine.importing.ImportingUtilities.createProjectSynchronously(ImportingUtilities.java:1137)
	at com.google.refine.importing.ImportingUtilities.access$1(ImportingUtilities.java:1083)
	at com.google.refine.importing.ImportingUtilities$7.run(ImportingUtilities.java:1075)
```

This is a critical bug because Data Package integration breaks an unrelated existing importer.

The following file can be used to reproduce the bug:
http://pintoch.ulminfo.fr/ebae3e8b22/jorf.xml

Version of OpenRefine used (Google Refine 2.6, OpenRefine2.8, an other distribution?):
-----
Current build from Master branch

Operating Systems and version:
-----
MacOS High Sierra

Browser + version used - Please note that OpenRefine doesn't support Internet Explorer but works OK in most cases:
-----
All

Steps followed to create the issue:
-----
Build OR from current Master branch. Run, and create a project.
Close down OR and run OR 2.8
Try to open the project you've just created

If you are allowed and are OK with making your data public, it would be awesome if you can include the data causing the issue or a URL pointing to where the data is (if your concerned about keeping your data private, ping us on our mailing list):
-----

Current Results:
-----
Trying to open projects created with the current Master branch build with OR2.8 results in a null pointer exception in the console:

```
09:47:41.807 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-all-project-metadata (2199ms)
09:47:41.810 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-version (3ms)
09:47:41.813 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-preference (3ms)
09:47:41.832 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-languages (19ms)
09:47:41.922 [                   refine] POST /command/core/load-language (90ms)
09:47:41.930 [                   refine] POST /command/core/load-language (8ms)
09:47:41.974 [                   refine] POST /command/core/get-importing-configuration (44ms)
09:47:58.295 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-project-metadata (16321ms)
09:47:58.297 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-models (2ms)
09:47:58.303 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-history (6ms)
09:47:58.303 [          org.mortbay.log] /command/core/get-history (0ms)
java.lang.NullPointerException
09:47:58.309 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-preference (6ms)
09:47:58.440 [                   refine] POST /command/core/load-language (131ms)
09:47:58.450 [                   refine] POST /command/core/load-language (10ms)
09:47:58.495 [                   refine] GET /command/core/get-history (45ms)
09:47:58.496 [          org.mortbay.log] /command/core/get-history (1ms)
java.lang.NullPointerException
09:47:58.496 [                   refine] POST /command/core/get-rows (0ms)
09:48:31.303 [           ProjectManager] Saving some modified projects ... (32807ms)
java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
09:48:31.326 [        project_utilities] Saved project '2163984995183' (23ms)
```
and an error in the browser console:
`Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (Internal Server Error)` 

The same project will open without a problem if you switch back to using the Master branch build.

Expected Results:
-----
Project should load in previous versions of OpenRefine, ideally back to 2.5

This should give the error indicating that toNumber() requires a single argument which is an object of some type (usually a string?)
issues.title: toNumber returns null if run with zero arguments

issues.body: Currently using toNumber function with an empty string `"".toNumber()` results in `null`. This is  incorrect. Rather the function should return the error "Cannot parse to number" as it would with any other string that cannot be parsed to a Long or Double
issues.title: toNumber handling of empty string

issues.title: Error on Wikitable import using "Extract references in additional columns" option

issues.body:
If you select column1 and change some options for it, then click on another column2 and change some options on it, then go back to column1, the Options dialog state is not saved.  Notice we actually have text above the Options section that states "Options for Column1" , "Options for Column2".

I don't know when this broke, but it was hinged around Reconciling I thought, but honestly cannot remember...so ?  @wetneb any idea ?

issues.body:
I'm not sure if it is the same bug as the one described for previous versions:
In OR 2.8 on Mac, I am trying to fetch the json data behind this URL : https://geo.api.gouv.fr/communes?lon=1.083333&lat=49.433333

With caching off, OR gives me in the resulting column ("wo_cache_clear") the content of an other column of my project! (value = "Populated", which is present in 2 of my columns). I have never encountered this bug before !

issues.title: Projects with timezone in modified time metadata are not displayed in Open Project
issues.body:
This is on the current Master branch with new Tags functionality implemented. None of my projects created on a pre-tags version of OR display in the Open Project screen. However, projects created with the Tags version of OR do display even if no tags assigned.

The 'All' option should display all projects, no matter whether any Tags metadata exists or not.

It's not clear to me which change introduced that, but when starting OpenRefine (as it currently is in master), it loads up every project I have in my workspace. That is of course out of question given that many of them only fit tightly in RAM.

issues.title: Flyout service amputates ids with a hash character "#"
issues.body:
In the [suggest API](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/wiki/Reconciliation-Service-API#suggest-apis), it seems like the flyout service returns a partial id string if the id has a "#" character. For example, if the id is `somedomain#sometopic` and the flyout endpoint is `/api/flyout`, openrefine will try to make a request to 

`.../api/flyout?id=somedomain`

instead of

`.../api/flyout?id=somedomain#sometopic`

This can be reproduced in OpenRefine2.8 on Mac OS 10.13

Any idea?

In the project list under "Open Project", each time a project is opened, the "last modified" date of the project is reset, even when no edits were made. The time stamp however should only be updated when actual changes are made to the project (i.e. steps are added to the history). 

Steps to reproduce: 

- Start OpenRefine
- Go to "Open Project" and select an old project (preferably one that is not on top of the list)
- Open the project and do nothing
- Go back to the OpenRefine start page
- Refresh the page by pressing F5
- Go to "Open Project"
- The viewed project is now on top of the list with the current time as "last modified"

Alternatively a second column for "Last viewed" could be added for this kind of behavior but the "Last modified" column should remain stable until the project is actually modified. 

System Info
- OpenRefine 2.8 (this behavior was not present in 2.7)
- Windows 7
- Tested with Firefox 57 and Chrome 63.
issues.title: Update "Last modified" date only when project is actually modified and not when it is just opened

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Migrate "Match all filtered cells" to use standard reconciliation services

Closes #1376.

issues.title: Reconcile->"Match All Filtered Cells to..." option
issues.body:
The "Match All Filtered Cells to..." action (under the Reconcile/Actions section of the column drop down menu) is designed to look up a value on Freebase and allow the user to match all cells (in the current filtered view) to that Freebase topic.

Since Freebase no longer exists, this option no longer works as expected.

On the basis we shouldn't have options that don't work, I suggest that we:

* Remove this option for now
* Consider implementing a new, similar, option, but one which (a) uses the Suggest API and (b) allows the user to choose from any Reconciliation target implementing the Suggest API which the install of OR has in its list of registered reconciliation services

Comments? @thadguidry @ettorerizza @wetneb

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Preserve international characters in project/file names on import/export (#2720)

* Preserve international characters on import/export

Fixes #1352. Preserve non-ASCII characters in project names on
project creation and filenames on export.

Uses existing filename cleaner with the addition of a few
more characters from StackOverflow, plus "#" which messes
up the download URL. Also URIencode download URL.

Removes unused I18N-incompatible cleaning function from
Wikidata extension rather than fixing it.

* Use common name cleaner function

Also preview cleaned table name instead of raw name, so user can see it.
Also add a TODO for better preview of column names

Preserve international characters in project/file names on import/export (#2720)

* Preserve international characters on import/export

Fixes #1352. Preserve non-ASCII characters in project names on
project creation and filenames on export.

Uses existing filename cleaner with the addition of a few
more characters from StackOverflow, plus "#" which messes
up the download URL. Also URIencode download URL.

Removes unused I18N-incompatible cleaning function from
Wikidata extension rather than fixing it.

* Use common name cleaner function

Also preview cleaned table name instead of raw name, so user can see it.
Also add a TODO for better preview of column names

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Add server-side language fallback.

This allows to keep the same Javascript calls to load languages, so it
does not require any change for extensions to benefit from this.

Closes #1350. Fixes #2209.

issues.title: Cannot edit project metadata if OR is not in English
issues.body:
Could it be simply because the word "About" needs to be translated? 

![screenshot-localhost-3333-2017-11-20-13-31-48-005](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6286410/33018579-41e93852-cdf7-11e7-8fec-17ef5d53e7f2.jpeg)
The duplicate key should be removed. otherwise will mess up the index page.
issues.title: put a filter when user define the userMetadata

issues.body:
The RowCount in the Project metadata is only updated when the project is saved to file. This only happens after the autosave interval (default 5 minutes) or on quitting OpenRefine.

This means that changes (e.g. removal of rows from a project) are not reflected in the project metadata display until the save has happened.
issues.title: RowCount Project Metadata only updated on Project File save

issues.title: Importing multiple Excel workbooks, each with multiple sheets
issues.body:
**Refine**: Version 2.7
**OS**: Windows 7 Enterprise, Service Pack 1
**Browser**: Chrome - Version 61.0.3163.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)
**Google group thread**: [https://groups.google.com/d/msg/openrefine/EZ24zNWbzqo/mMNlPoLBAAAJ](url)

Opening a project with multiple Excel workbooks, each with a variable number of sheets, is causing some wonky behavior.  Users are only allowed to select the sheets to include from the first workbook.  If subsequent workbooks have more sheets than the first, only the number of initially selected sheets are pulled into the project.  If a workbook has less sheets than are initially selected, the project will hang during creation.  I've attached some files to test this behavior.  An option for 'select all sheets' would be helpful, in cases where there are a great number of sheets and selecting each one individually would be tedious.

> I've attached 4 of the workbooks that I am processing as an example.  If you create a new project and select the four files from your computer, when you get to Configure Parsing Option, you only are presented with the names of the sheet from the first workbook.  In my case, those are the sheets in Al-Ahram, of which there are only four.  

> I'm not given an option to select more sheets, even though Alamphon and Al-chark both have eight sheets each.  I put Concert Record (with only two sheets) as an example, because when you try to create the project, having selected the four sheets that are present in Al-Ahram, the project won't be created - it will just hang.  Try it with all four first to see the hanging, then try to create a project with just Al-Ahram, Alamphon and Al-chark.  For the three files, my goal is to see the data from all 20 sheets in Refine.  I'm currently only able to create a project with 16 sheets.

[Al-Ahram.xlsx](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/files/1471317/Al-Ahram.xlsx)
[Alamphon.xlsx](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/files/1471318/Alamphon.xlsx)
[Al-chark.xlsx](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/files/1471319/Al-chark.xlsx)
[Concert Record.xlsx](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/files/1471320/Concert.Record.xlsx)

While working on a quick hack for #1319 

If Expression Language is set to Clojure and using the toString method the following expression works:

```(.toString(org.apache.commons.lang.math.IntRange. 7,12))```

and output is 
```Range[7,12]```

however when using the toArray method, it breaks with error in console

```(.toArray(org.apache.commons.lang.math.IntRange. 7,12))```

issues.title: metadata dialog messed up when have long value
issues.body: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/1221#issuecomment-341939286

We need to replace literal backslashes with additional backslashes to solve this issue.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4653831/regex-how-to-escape-backslashes-and-special-characters

**Reproducible Steps:**
Using OpenRefine [trunk] 

This can be reproduced with any text cell value, for instance

1. Add text filter on column.
2. Type into the text filter column ...

```^tha```

3. now type 1 more character, a backslash character \

```^tha\```

4. Notice that you get an Unexpected internal error above dialog.
5. Its not an error yet to the user since they are still typing, its just an incomplete expression and we should probably be nicer and give them a more friendly helpful message as other data tools do.
issues.title: Text filter causes exception when regex pattern is not yet complete

![datepart_incorrect_milliseconds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/986438/31972204-1d068ff2-b8e5-11e7-9ccb-bc031a04c335.PNG)

With value being :

```05/18/2016 11:54:26.5550```

and applying GREL of 

```value.toDate("MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss.S")```
or
```value.toDate("MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss.SSSS")```
or even just
```value.toDate("MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss.")```

it seems that the millliseconds are not parsed out as the SimpleDateFormat docs suggest
```
Date and Time Pattern | Result
-- | --
"yyyy.MM.dd G 'at' HH:mm:ss z" | 2001.07.04 AD at 12:08:56 PDT
"EEE, MMM d, ''yy" | Wed, Jul 4, '01
"h:mm a" | 12:08 PM
"hh 'o''clock' a, zzzz" | 12 o'clock PM, Pacific Daylight Time
"K:mm a, z" | 0:08 PM, PDT
"yyyyy.MMMMM.dd GGG hh:mm aaa" | 02001.July.04 AD 12:08 PM

"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ" | 2001-07-04T12:08:56.235-0700

"YYYY-'W'ww-u" | 2001-W27-3
```
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

Maybe its actually a java.util.Calendar bug or we missed something within it ?

issues.title: Fingerprint and diacritics
issues.body:
This is definitely the week of [technical questions on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46431278/openrefine-key-collision-fingerprint-clustering-diacritics/46432683#46432683). 

In this case, I wonder if the original poster did not point to a real anomaly. Indeed, `fingerprint()` does not give the same results on "école école ecole" as on "école école école". This is because the non-ascii characters normalization [is done last](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/wiki/Clustering-In-Depth#fingerprint). 

**Example :** 

```
1. remove leading and trailing whitespace

" école école école " -> "école école école"

2. change all characters to their lowercase representation

"éCole écoLe école" -> "école école école"

3. remove all punctuation and control characters

"école-école, école" -> "école école école"

4. split the string into whitespace-separated tokens

"école école école" -> ["école", "école", "école"]

5. sort the tokens and remove duplicates

["école", "école", "école"] -> ["école"]

BUT

["école", "école", "ecole"] -> ["ecole", "école"]

6. join the tokens back together

["école"] -> "école"

["ecole", "école"] -> "ecole école"

7. normalize extended western characters to their ASCII representation**

"école" -> "ecole"

"ecole école" -> "ecole ecole"
```


Should the operation 7 not be done before to ensure more uniform results with ngramm-strings containing diacritics?

issues.body:
From Pull #1246

When adding a "Best candidate's score" facet to a column with equal reconciliation scores, I get the following facet JSON:

 {
          "to": 1,
          "expression": "cell.recon.best.score",
          "selectError": false,
          "selectNumeric": true,
          "selectBlank": true,
          "name": "occupation: best candidate's score",
          "columnName": "occupation",
          "selectNonNumeric": true,
          "from": 100,
          "type": "range"
        }
I think the problem is rather in the UI: the facet selection UI looks buggy in that case. (In the JSON above, the "to": 1 is wrong).

Anyway, I think it would be quite dangerous to change the semantics of the range facets: this can potentially break a lot of user scripts. We just need to make sure that OpenRefine generates the right facet (with min=score and max=score+1) by default.
issues.title: Range facet to/from is incorrect for Reconciling "Best candidate's score"

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Use ContentDisposition instead of ContentType to control download (#2722)

* Use ContentDisposition instead of ContentType to control download

Fixes #1197. Previously we were using a funky ContentType to attempt
to force a file download rather than display in browser, but this
conflicted with attempts to save UTF-8 which was outside the Basic
Multilingual Plane (BMP).

By switching to ContentDisposition: attachment, which has been
the preferred method for a number of years, we can avoid this conflict.

As part of this, switch to using the "preview" param consistently
to control preview vs download rather than the content type.

* Switch content type to text/plain

Now that we don't need to use ContentType to control download
behavior, we can use something more reasonable.

Use ContentDisposition instead of ContentType to control download (#2722)

to force a file download rather than display in browser, but this
conflicted with attempts to save UTF-8 which was outside the Basic
Multilingual Plane (BMP).

By switching to ContentDisposition: attachment, which has been
the preferred method for a number of years, we can avoid this conflict.

As part of this, switch to using the "preview" param consistently
to control preview vs download rather than the content type.

* Switch content type to text/plain

Now that we don't need to use ContentType to control download
behavior, we can use something more reasonable.

issues.body:
From our mailing list 
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/openrefine/72b5r3QQQcQ

"I noticed a scenario related to cell.cross not working for me on occasion:

If I export a refine project (or both) from one computer to another (in this case, always Mac to Mac, but sometimes different OS X versions), cross does not work numeric values.

This has happened to me three times:
1. Exported Google Refine project from iMac running Yosemite to an old 17" MacBook Pro running either Yosemite or earlier (possibly Snow Leopard).
2. Exported Google Refine project from the same iMac to a new 15" MacBook Pro running El Capitan and OpenRefine 2.6 beta 1
3. Exported OpenRefine 2.6 beta 1 project from new Mac Mini running El Capitan to the same 15" MBP (e.g., both with the same configuration)

(I did not test these situations with my Linux and Windows 10 installations of Open Refine.) What I was doing was trying to cross-join on a standardized college ID (from http://nces.ed.gov/collegenavigator). I first tried with the string versions, first making sure to trim() and strip() spaces in both projects, and sorted the target project. No luck. I changed the ID toNumber() in both projects. No luck. I tried with the college names and it worked just fine. I had this exact same problem in the other scenarios listed, always on the ID, if either or both of the projects were imported from another Mac. If I create two projects on the same Mac, I can join them.

Now here's how I solved it, just this very minute. I created a duplicate column of the college id values in both projects and converted them toString(). Then I tried to join on these two new columns created on the same computer, and it lo and behold, it worked perfectly. 

To further test my premise (numeric values don't join from projects created on other computers, whether in text or numeric mode), I then converted both new columns to numbers, did the join again, and verified that both sets of restults are identical.

Not sure if this helps you. If I knew more Java (and had more than 10 free minutes per week), I'd try to hunt down the problem in the code. Unfortunately, I can't help there."

issues.title: Inconsistent selection behavior with "Cluster & Edit"
issues.body:
In the "Cluster & Edit" window, if I select a checkbox (to indicate that I want to merge entries) and select merge, the merge works as expected. Or if instead I click on one of the entries (to change the value to be used for merging) and then select merge, the merge works as expected. But if I select a checkbox AND click on one of the entries, I get an error dialog, stating: "The page at localhost:3333 says: You must check some Edit? checkboxes for your edits to be applied." Only by carefully _un_checking the checkbox will the merge proceed as intended. Alternatively, re-clicking on one of the entries will allow the merge to proceed. Clicking on an entry should only re-affirm the checkbox's checked status; it should not un-select the checkbox or cause a hidden selection toggle.

(I'm using 2.6RC1 with current versions of Mac OS X and Google Chrome.)

issues.title: Ampersands not escaped when exporting to HTML
issues.body:
Using v2.6-RC1, when a cell value contains an ampersand (i.e., `&`), this ampersand is not escaped (i.e., to `&`) when exporting. As a result, the exported HTML is not compatible with applications that expect well-formed XHTML. 

Would it be possible to escape ampersands in HTML output?

If a cell contains 'null' when you access the cell value using 'value' you get 'null': However, if you access the same cell through 'cells["col name"].value you get an error instead: This means that you get inconsistent behaviour when using GREL expressions that check for null - e.g. isNull: vs The behaviour here should be consistent - preferably you should get 'null' whether you use the 'value' syntax or the 'cells["Col name"].value' syntax
issues.title: Using cells["col name"].value on null gives error

issues.body:
A facet's _invert_ button is only visible if items from that facet are selected (i.e. if the facet is currently active).  _invert_ should be visible, and clickable, at all times, so that one can:
- see more easily whether the facet is in "include" or "exclude" mode, i.e. what clicking on one of its items will do (one can infer this from the signs of the item counts, but showing the state explicitly would improve usability)
- toggle that state without having to select an item first
issues.title: Facet's "Invert" button should always be visible

issues.body:
Java memory allocation soars past whatever I can max at (-Xmx1200M on a 32-bit Windows 7 OS, Java 8u31) when trying to open what would seem to be (at first glance) a small .xslx file

In truth, it's a file of 10 worksheets, 35,000 rows by 4 columns each = 1.4 million cells in total, so it's well compressed in the .xslx format. However, if I convert it to the old .xls format, the file becomes bigger, but is now manageable by OpenRefine.

One thing I did notice is that the POI documentation (http://poi.apache.org/spreadsheet/quick-guide.html#FileInputStream) states that using InputStreams rather than Files can increase memory footprint, and poking about in the code (ExcelImporter.java) it seems to be using InputStreams rather than Files to open worksheets etc, I wonder if changing to use Files for excel .xslx data is possible and would make a difference?
issues.title: Out of memory crash with 7MB excel file

issues.body:
I tried to replace the openjdk6 to oraclejdk8 on my branch. Some UT failed:
https://travis-ci.org/jackyq2015/OpenRefine/jobs/48385702

It's related to the HashMap value iteration order in JDK8 is not historical. In JDK7, the values will be retrieved in the the same order that were inserted. But JDK8 doesn't guarantee this. 
I think if we want to make sure of the order, we should use LinkedHashMap instead of HashMap even for JDK7:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/LinkedHashMap.html

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fix #896 - TextSearchFacet refreshes unnecessarily

Merge pull request #972 from gideonthomas/issue896

Fix #896 - TextSearchFacet refreshes unnecessarily

issues.title: TextSearchFacet refreshes unnecessarily
issues.body:
When you ctrl/PageUp or ctrl/PageDn into a page, the TextSearchFacet's event handler fires when e.g. the PageUp key is released, causing a complete facet refresh even though the value in the input field hasn't changed.  This is annoying in trivial cases, but can be a real pain if the current facet setup is expensive to compute.

The event handler is set up in TextSearchFacet._initializeUI()

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Remove obsolete Chrome Frame support - fixes #889

issues.title: OpenRefine 2.6 doesn't work on IE due to Chrome Frame retirement
issues.body:
I tried using **OpenRefine 2.6** with IE11, however I got the message "_We've wound down Chrome Frame and ceased support_"

PS With Firefox, and Opera however, it works.

When using '/command/core/set-preference' with parameters 'project', 'name' and 'value' everything looks fine (value can be retrieved per project using '/command/core/get-preference'), but shutting down OpenRefine and restarting it shows that the preferences where not saved. It looks like the project is not marked as 'dirty'. The evidence for this is that If you do some other editing in the project, the preferences are saved.

My workaround at this time is to use '/command/core/rename-project' to rename the project to the name it already has, causing the project to be marked 'dirty'.
issues.title: Preferences for projects are not saved

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Improve error messages - fixes #878

issues.title: Phonetic function arguments, error message and documentation
issues.body:
Using GREL function 'phonetic'
Within Refine the Help documentation for phonetic says:

```
phonetic    (string s, string encoding (optional, defaults to 'metaphone3'))
returns: string
Returns the a phonetic encoding of s (optionally indicating which encoding to use')
```

Currently the 'encoding' parameter is not optional - if the parameter is not included the function fails with the error:

"phonetic expects 3 strings"

This is also incorrect as the function expects 2 strings

Either the help information should be updated to remove the statement that the encoding is optional, or the function should be updated to work as advertised.

In either case the error message should be corrected to say the function expects 2 strings

issues.title: Unable to export project to Excel

issues.body:
Google Refine has severe problems with handling nulls (https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/332, https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/252)

My problem was, that I cannot concatenate column values when one cell was null.
The solution is to "blank" cells not with null but with empty string. But there is no such option!

1)When you use option Edit cells -> Common transformations -> Blank out cells - Google Refine sets all cells to null.
2)When you do Edit cells -> Transform and you put "" - Google Refine sets all cells to null either!
3)Edit cells -> Transform and " ".trim() doesn't do anything
4)Luckily Edit cells -> Transform and " " and then Edit cells -> Common transformations -> Trim leading and trailing whitespace does the job right.

Conclusion
1)Bullets no. 2 and 3 above should perform exactly the same as no. 4
2)There should be two options: "Blank out cells" and "Null out cells"
3)Google refine should allow to concatenate nulls treating them as empty strings
4)"Text facet" should not treat nulls exactly the same as empty stings - currently both are displayed as (blank) and you cannot distinguish one from another

Kind regards
issues.title: Inconsistency with handling null and empty string - (blank)

Reconciling people who have birth and death dates formatted as ISO strings yields 90+% matches, while the same dates after being converted to Refine dates using toDate yields reconciliation matches in the single digit range.

As an example, 

```
J. D. Salinger 1919-01-01T00:00:00Z 2010-01-27T00:00:00Z
```

is a 7% match (same as if no dates are included) while

```
J. D. Salinger 1919-01-01 2010-01-27
```

is a 98% match

issues.body: CSVs which have embedded newlines in cells (ie multiline cells) confuse the separator guesser and it ends up not being confident enough in its guess.  This is due to treating each line independently, without taking into account quotes.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fix small Freebase preview widget text - fixes #763

issues.title: Freebase preview widget text is too small
issues.body: The preview that we build using the Suggest flyout has the text sized to 62.5%.  This is intended to be applied to the 16pt base size used by Suggest, but instead gets applied to Refine's already small text size making it truly tiny.  We need to insert a div that we can style and set its font size.

issues.body:
Hi,

"filter([ null, "this is a string", null ], v, isNotNull(v))"
I want to get the string "this is a string", but, it shows "Error: java.lang.NullPointerException"

Records sets of 150k or above are really slow to sort. It seems there's something off in the implementation, apart from simply locking and not using multiple cores. There is very little code in the sorting namespace but something seems to have gone wrong here. Note that it is locked on RuleBasedCollator, but I doubt that's the only issue as I am seeing a CPU stuck on full usage for many minutes at a time. It appears the issue gets worse as record sets get larger. The issue is not particularly notable on sets of 20k records.

issues.body: The history-extract-dialog-panel class needs a maximum width so that overflow on long lines does push out the textarea beyond the available space.
issues.title: Undo History Extract panel needs max width

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Add locale support to toDate() - fixes #729

issues.title: toDate() can't parse dates in non-default locale
issues.body:
Hi,
I just encounter this issue:
I'm trying to parse a string to date using Refine, for example:
"01-六月-2013".toDate('dd-MMM-yyyy') is OK!
"01-Jun-2013".toDate('dd-MMM-yyyy') will print: Error: Cannot parse to date
First, I'm in China.

When working with a workflow where Row (B) is sorted and contains no blanks, then Row (A) is sorted and does contain blanks, the result is correct, with basically a record style layout; but when selecting Sort -> Reorder rows permanently, the sorting on screen is lost and it seems to sort out of order, sorting only by the first sort selector.
issues.title: Two column sort does not work with "permanently reorder rows"

issues.body:
Hello,

I´ve problem with the ngram Fingerprint method. When I start it the custom setting is 2. After changing it to 1, refine crashes....Why? How and where can I manually type in the posted code? How and where do I set the specific column I want to apply the ngram Fingerprint on?

Thanks.

Regards,

JS
issues.title: ngram Fingerprint

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Compute delay from request issue, not response return.  Fixes #721

issues.title: Delay for fetch URL should be computed from request, not response
issues.body: Currently the delay specified by the user is taken unconditionally after the response is returned.  It makes more sense to compute the delay from request to request subtract the response time from the computed delay.

I have a spreadsheet that has a couple thousadn rows spread out over maybe 20 worksheets.  If I just try to import one or two it works fine but if I try to import all of them the import always hangs (twice I let it run for over an hour).

I can provide the spreadsheet.  Also I used some simple perl code (yeah I'm that old :^) to convert the mutli worksheet thing into a single worksheet and that imports into refine just fine.
issues.title: Import of spreadsheet with mutliple worksheets hangs

issues.body:

Any ideas why? thanks!

Clicking one of the names in a cluster should both select that cluster for merging and use the selected name as the target for the whole cluster.  It's currently only doing the first part of this. issues.title: Clicking name in clustering dialog doesn't make it the target

issues.body: Any time an error happens in Python code, the display in Refine is "Error: null" which isn't very helpful.  This appears to be because .getMessage() on a Jython exception returns null.  We should either use .toString() or assemble our own message.
issues.title: Jython doesn't report errors properly

issues.body: Properties such as Alias or Official Webpage aren't selectable, even with a fully specified ID.
issues.title: Can't choose /common/topic properties for Add Column from Freebase

issues.body:
When selecting a type for a column to be included in the reconciliation process, the only property which Suggest will allow you to choose are those which are part of the selected type.  This is too strict and the user should be able to select any property, with preference being given to those which are part of the selected type.

I suspect this is another side effect of the upgrade to the new Suggest.
issues.title: Reconcile column type overly constrained

issues.body: If you attempt to reconcile a column containing a date, it gets sent to the server in the default text format.  It should be converted to ISO format before sending so that Freebase understands it.
issues.title: Dates not reconciled correctly

issues.body: The type match facet doesn't do anything and the field that it depends on, cell.recon.feature.typeMatch, is inaccessible.
issues.title: Type match facet does't work

issues.title: Java version 8 not detected by start script in Linux
issues.body:
I am using java 8 64-bit under Ubuntu Linux 12.04 (64-bit), and the start script for version 2.5 r2407 does not recognize this version. 

The fix is trivial and shown below:

```
$ diff -u refine-old  refine
--- refine-old  2011-12-11 17:08:39.000000000 -0500
+++ refine  2013-02-01 10:45:21.789571935 -0500
@@ -827,6 +827,7 @@

 # ----- Make sure there is an appropriate java environment is available -------------

+
 if [ "$OS" = "macosx" ] ; then
     if [ -z "$JAVA_HOME" ] ; then
         # Mac OS X defaults to Java 5. So update JAVA_HOME unless the user manually set it.
@@ -844,7 +845,7 @@
     error "Could not find the 'java' executable at '$JAVA', are you sure your JAVA_HOME environment variable is pointing to a proper java installation?"
 fi

-JAVA_VERSION=`$JAVA -version 2>&1 | grep version | cut -d ' ' -f 3 | egrep '^\"1\.(6|7)'`
+JAVA_VERSION=`$JAVA -version 2>&1 | grep version | cut -d ' ' -f 3 | egrep '^\"1\.(6|7|8)'`
 if [ -z "$JAVA_VERSION" ] ; then
     error "Google Refine requires Java version 6 or later. If you have multiple versions of Java installed, please set the environment variable JAVA_HOME to the correct version."
 fi

```

If you have a project with 15 rows, and you set the pagination to 5 rows, clicking on 'last >>' results in showing rows 16 - 15 (in effect showing nothing since there are only 15 rows).

The bug is in file 'OpenRefine / main / webapp / modules / core / scripts / views / data-table / data-table-view.js' on line 505 in the onClickLastPage function, where

```
this._showRows(Math.floor(theProject.rowModel.filtered / this._pageSize) * this._pageSize);
```

should be changed into

```
this._showRows(Math.floor((theProject.rowModel.filtered - 1) / this._pageSize) * this._pageSize);
```
issues.title: bug in onClickLastPage

issues.body: As reported by Thad, CSV files which contained embedded NUL characters will cause the NULs to be interpreted as the escape character.  If this occurs just before the quote that terminates the field, the quote character will be interpreted as an embedded quote instead of the field terminator.
issues.title: CSV files with embedded NUL characters aren't parsed correctly

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Use iterator when removing to avoid ConcurrentModificationException -
fixes #652

issues.title: ConcurrentModificationException when flushing projects at shutdown
issues.body:
User Ryan Elenbaum reported this exception when shutting down the Refine server

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
        at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:894)
        at java.util.HashMap$EntryIterator.next(HashMap.java:934)
        at java.util.HashMap$EntryIterator.next(HashMap.java:932)
        at com.google.refine.InterProjectModel.flushJoinsInvolvingProject(InterProjectModel.java:109)
        at com.google.refine.model.Project.dispose(Project.java:109)
        at com.google.refine.ProjectManager.saveProjects(ProjectManager.java:265) 
        at com.google.refine.ProjectManager.save(ProjectManager.java:206)
        at com.google.refine.ProjectManager.dispose(ProjectManager.java:99)
        at com.google.refine.RefineServlet.destroy(RefineServlet.java:151)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.destroyInstance(ServletHolder.java:318)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.doStop(ServletHolder.java:289)
        at org.mortbay.component.AbstractLifeCycle.stop(AbstractLifeCycle.java:76)

1. Start with a CSV/TSV file and then create some records with a join() then split multi valued cells.
2. Export the rows using Custom Tabular Exporter as TSV and uncheck the option to Output blank rows.
3. Inspect the exported file and notice that it has blank rows.

The blank rows at the end of the exported file seem to be those blank record rows leftover from my split that did not get expunged with the Output blank rows as unchecked.

On further inspection, it seems that rows that contain blanks are output, but rows with null are not.  Output blank rows, should perhaps be renamed to Output null rows or change the logic to also include blank cells as well as null cells ???
issues.title: Output blank rows option not working in Custom Tabular Exporter

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Tooltip is updated after changing facet expression - fixed #649

Merge pull request #669 from sparkica/fix_facet_tooltip

Tooltip is updated after changing facet expression - fixed #649

issues.title: Tooltip not updated when facet expression is changed
issues.body:
Create a new project from clipboard using the following data:

Row;List
1;One, Two, Three
2;One, Four
3;Two
4;Five, Three

Create a text facet on column "List".

Change the expression in the "List" facet by clicking on "change", using the expression:

value.split(', ')

Hover with the mouse over the "change" link and notice that the tooltip that appears still says "Current Expression: value". This is even worse when you click on it, because then it hides the real expression, while still showing the previous expression in the tooltip.

Herwig Van Marck

Add a new project from clipboard using the following data:

Entry;Date
1;2012-12-17T10:28:10Z
2;2012-11-30T12:31:26Z
3;2012-11-28T17:24:49Z
4;2012-09-25T11:39:09Z
5;2012-02-29T08:55:08Z

Then transform the "Date" column using the expression

value.toDate()

Then create a timeline facet on column "Date".

When you drag the left handle of the timeline facet to filter out the left most data point (corresponding to the date 2012-02-29T08:55:08Z) you will notice that the most recent date (corresponding to 2012-12-17T10:28:10Z) is also filtered out!

Herwig Van Marck
issues.title: Timeline facet bug

issues.body:
Currently if a user specifies a property which is not on the pick list by using Suggest, the expected_type is hardcoded to /type/object which prevents the use of any constraint which filters on a property of the expected type.

For example if I type to add /type/object/key, I can't use /type/key/namespace to constrain the namespace of the keys being selected (if e.g. I want just Wikipedia or VIAF or OpenLibrary keys).
issues.title: Add column from Freebase with user supplied property can't be constrained

issues.body: If you attempt to select a topic for which Freebase Suggest/Search doesn't return a notable type, the UI will silently fail to allow it to be selected due to an error in the underlying code that assumes notable types are always returned.
issues.title: Reconciliation search doesn't allow topics with no notable types to be selected

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Blacklist /common/document in Suggest - fixes #632

issues.title: Blacklist /common/document in Suggest options
issues.body:
Per https://bugs.freebase.com/browse/SITE-1173 we should add 

  filter=(not type:/common/document)

to our Suggest options to keep from getting lists of nameless, unselectable /m/id entries returned.

Probably need to look at the selection logic at the same time and make sure it matches what we're telling Suggest.  Currently you can pick these entries from the dropdown, but they don't cause the reconciliation dialog to be dismissed.  If we only accept /common/topic objects (which seems reasonable), we may want to pass that constraint through to Suggest.

Attempting to use the constraint from #92 with Population -> Number (ie the number property of the Population CVT) doesn't work.  The problem is that the front end is setting the constraints property on the nested property, but the backend is looking only at the top level.

We need to not only make them agree, but also make the user aware of which context (ie top level or nested), they are writing the constraint for.

This was initially reported on the mailing  list and here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12956498/google-refine-add-column-from-freebase-constraint-does-not-seem-to-work
issues.title: Constraints on nested properties (ie CVTs) don't work when adding from Freebase

issues.body:
_Original author: s...@google.com (October 03, 2012 21:18:30)_

The current suggest widget being used in Refine uses deprecated and one-off hack APIs which will be offline soon. This patch updates refine to use a new version of the suggest widget that uses the new Freebase APIs.

The new APIs however require an API key so I am adding a default API key with a new option in the freebase dropdown to set a custom API key.

See http://wiki.freebase.com/wiki/Freebase_Suggest

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=628_

_Original author: Martin.M...@gmail.com (September 30, 2012 23:04:55)_

The issue was in the discussion list but not in the issues. I just encounter the same today: 

I'm trying to find the number of days difference between two dates using Refine.  I know I can do it by doing the subtraction and division with the dates as seconds, but it seems like the diff command is supposed to work for this.  For example:

diff("10/12/2012".toDate(),"10/14/2012".toDate(), "days")
or
diff("10/12/2012".toDate(),"10/10/2012".toDate(), "days")

I would expect to see 2, but it just gives me null.

(source: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!searchin/google-refine/date/google-refine/pimNnOExyjU/YhvWndLfBskJ)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=625_

issues.body: _Original author: palpalpa...@gmail.com (August 14, 2012 00:02:18)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a new project with the following (tab-separated) text in the clipboard: Column1 Column2 v1 v2 v3 v4 1. Parse data as "CSV / TSV / separator-based files", with default settings. 2. In "Undo / Redo", apply the following: [ { "op": "core/column-move", "description": "Move column Column1 to position 4", "columnName": "Column1", "index": 4 } ] What is the expected output? The expected result should be either an error or Column1 moving to the right of Column2 and a new operation being registered in "Undo / Redo". What do you see instead? issues.body:
_Original author: sergio@wikier.org (May 29, 2012 13:27:30)_

The ReconciliationManager get a inconsistent state after deleting a service. I figured out of such problem with the following steps:
1. Delete a reconcile service using the dialog
2. Programmatically add the same service uri
3. The ReconciliationManager.getServiceFromUrl() method still returns the service deleted at the first step

Attached a patch that solves the issue. Although So I can't assert that is a bug or an error on my usage of the API. So, if'd help, the code that arise this issue can be found at: http://code.google.com/p/lmf/source/browse/module/scripts/stanbol-reconciliation-configuration.js?repo=refine#44

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=579_

issues.body:
_Original author: ericjarv...@gmail.com (May 05, 2012 16:42:29)_

Behavior modification request:

-When editing large numbers of records, and on high page numbers(e.g.- page 5000 of 10,000), when the user edits a records and applies the change to all of the same(e.g.- Edit > Apply to all identical cells), the table refreshes back to the first page. Suffice it to say, it is a major drag having to manually click 'next... next... next...' 500 times to get back to record 5000.  

The ideal behavior when using 'Edit > Apply to all identical cells' should be to refresh, but instead of kicking user back to the first record/page, it should refresh and maintain the same page(minus whatever records may have fallen off the Facet list).   

Thanks,

Eric Jarvies

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=569_
issues.title: Edit > Apply to all identical cells behavior modification

issues.body: _Original author: ericjarv...@gmail.com (May 03, 2012 12:08:34)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? before performing the following, take the key column and create a duplicate verson of it, fully populated with the values from key column, e,g,- id, id2, and then perform the following on the second column(id2) so after you 'blank down', etc., you will be able to more clearly see the bug: 1. Facets > Customized facets > Duplicates facet 2. Click true/include on facet 3. Return to column and Edit cells > Blank down 4. Facets > Customized facets > Facet by blank 5. Click true/include(or false include, whichever you prefer) on facet 6. All > Edit rows > Remove all matching rows 7. Now remove all facets from left pane, and create a duplicates facet again(like in step 1), and click true/include on the facet, and notice how the total number is the exact same as BEFORE you deleted the duplicates, this os BAD/WRONG. Also take a look at the records and notices the duplicates are not there(even know the facet count indicates they are), however, the orphans to the duplicates that were deleted ARE still there, which is BAD/WRONG, because they are no longer duplicate records, because their duplicates were deleted in step 6 above! This is an error that many people would likely not notice, and it took me sometime to figure out what was happening to my data... I finally found it was Refine that was the culprit, as one half to a duplicate pair was being constantly introduced into my supposedly cleaned records(arg.). Anyways, this should likely be made a high priority fix imo(along with the entire cache problem). What version of Google Refine are you using? What operating system and browser are you using? OS X 10.7.3 / CHROME 18.0.1025 Is this problem specific to the type of browser you're using or it happens in all the browsers you tried? Happens in all browsers. Thanks, Eric Jarvies _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=567_

Hi,

I've noticed that after clicking the menu item "Clear all reconciliation data" for a column - the column object in the columnModel still has the properties "reconConfig" and "reconStats" - which are both populated.

The extension we're working on attempts to detect whether the user has reconciled columns previously by looking for columns that have the "reconConfig" and "reconStats" properties.

Dan

_Original author: ericjarv...@gmail.com (February 26, 2012 14:25:07)_

When taking a column that is of a 'number' type and applying a transformation to change it to a column that is of a 'text' type, the data contained within the cells of that column end up having a decimal and a zero suffixed to it. 

For example, if the 'number' column(before the transformation) contained data such as this in the first 10 rows:
21
20
19
17
3
4
5
16
15
14

Then after the transformation(from 'number' to 'text') the data ends up like this:
21.0
20.0
19.0
17.0
3.0
4.0
5.0
16.0
15.0
14.0
(see the attached screenshots, before.png='number', after.png='text').

In my opinion, this seems a bit backwards, meaning, I would expect this behavior if I had a column that is of a 'text' type and am transforming it to a 'number' type, but even then I feel it should not auto-add the decimal point and trailing zero... this is something the user should invoke because s/he wishes to.

Thanks,

Eric Jarvies

or
enter page number[       ]  [Go]
# 

Thanks,

Eric Jarvies

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Make workspace saving and loading more robust - fixes #528
- don't overwrite old files if we get an error writing new ones
- don't write unchanged data
- keep backup files around until next write rather than deleting
immediately
- attempt to recreate missing metadata as best as possible

issues.title: Entire Refine workspace metadata trashed unrecoverably
issues.body:
_Original author: tfmorris (February 09, 2012 01:43:40)_

All of the projects in my Refine workspace directory have been renamed from .project to .project.corrupted and each contains a 0-byte metadata.json file.

I'm not sure exactly how this happened, but I suspect that Refine tried to shutdown when it was in a low-memory situation and ended up writing the 0-length files.  Although it uses a write, rename, delete strategy for updates, this only checks for the existence of the output file, not whether or not it contains valid data.

I think a few things need to be done differently:
- don't update project metadata which hasn't been modified
- don't delete the old metadata json file until the next time Refine has been started and successfully read in the newly written file (so that there's always a backup copy)
- probably other stuff after a little more code review

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=528_

_Original author: tfmorris (January 26, 2012 18:47:10)_

Currently Refine returns the Java exception message as the error message when the user asks for errors to be recorded, but this is often uninformative.  For example, for a 404 the exception is File Not Found and the message is the URL, so all the user sees is the failing URL (which they already knew).

Instead we should return the HTTP error code, error message, and HTML error page (contents of error stream) in the form "<code>, <message> | <html>"

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=523_
issues.title: Return all available HTTP error information on when Fetch URL fails

Restore character encoding guesser (#2755)

* Fixes #486. Builds on code from Steffen Stundzig

- Switch from ICU4J to juniversalchardet
  (Java port of Mozilla charset detector)
- Replace org.json code with Jackson
- Add tests
- Add TODO for multi-file character encoding mismatches

* Restore dependency lost in rebase

Co-authored-by: Steffen Stundzig <git@stundzig.de>

issues.title: Character encoding not being set in new projects
issues.body:
_Original author: tfmorris (November 18, 2011 19:42:20)_

The problems that Thad reported with reintepret here:

http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=237#c6

I think are due to the character encoding being set to "" in newly created projects.

It looks to me like if the user doesn't explicitly select a character encoding we are using "".

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=486_

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Have curl fail on all HTTP errors - fixes #481

issues.title: check_running lies when using curl and http_proxy
issues.body:
_Original author: keturn.k...@gmail.com (November 05, 2011 22:16:12)_

if the http_proxy environment variable is set to point to squid, the refine launch script falsely reports "Something is already running but it doesn't seem to be Google Refine."

curl -S -s http://127.0.0.1:3333/

returns this:

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd"> <html><head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=utf-8"> <title>ERROR: The requested URL could not be retrieved</title> <style type="text/css"><!--   %l  body :lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; } :lang(he) { direction: rtl; }  --></style> </head><body id=ERR_CONNECT_FAIL> <div id="titles"> <h1>ERROR</h1> <h2>The requested URL could not be retrieved</h2> </div> <hr>  <div id="content"> <p>The following error was encountered while trying to retrieve the URL: <a href="http://127.0.0.1:3333/">http://127.0.0.1:3333/</a></p>  <blockquote id="error"> <p><b>Connection to 127.0.0.1 failed.</b></p> </blockquote>  <p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>  <p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>  <p>Your cache administrator is <a href="mailto:kevint">kevint</a>.</p>  <br> </div>  <hr> <div id="footer"> <p>Generated Sat, 05 Nov 2011 22:14:07 GMT by elided (squid/2.7.STABLE9)</p> <!-- ERR_CONNECT_FAIL --> </div> </body></html> 

curl's --fail parameter might be useful here.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=481_

_Original author: thadguidry (November 05, 2011 17:29:57)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a project with a JSON file. 2. Preview shows, but do not pick or select anything yet. 3. Click checkbox to "Load at most record(s) of data" What is the expected output? What do you see instead? "Updating Preview" overlay spins endlessly. instead we should not update the preview until at least something is selected first. This might also happen with XML importer or other importers that use the interactive record selector... dunno, check those also & fix with this same issue. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=480_

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Turn all import conversions off by default - fixes #478

issues.title: All importers should support option to import without changing data
issues.body:
_Original author: tfmorris (November 05, 2011 16:27:17)_

It should be possible for users to turn off all unnecessary transformations of input data.  Many times these are irreversible, so the time to deal with them is at initial import.

One example is the XML importer has no way to turn off string->number conversion.  Other converters such strip leading and trailing double quotes that they find.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=478_

_Original author: tfmorris (November 04, 2011 19:20:50)_

Many of the importer options panels have a field to specify a line terminator other than the default \n, but, as far as I can tell, no importer actually implements that option.

We should either remove this option from the UI or get it implemented in the importer architecture.  I'm not sure, but I think we'd probably need to implement a filter which replaces the desired line terminator character with \n before passing the character stream along.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=477_
issues.title: Implement or remove the line separator option

issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (November 04, 2011 16:05:48)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. On a larger data set, use Sort command, then wait a few seconds and use Sort command again, wait a few seconds and use Sort command again. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Java heap grows with every instance of using the Sort command, even though the previous initial Sort is not finished yet. The user does not know this, and is not given a progress bar or "Working... panel" to note that Refine is still processing the initial Sort. I also suspect Refine (via programmatically such as with Paul Makepeace's Python client) will also allow a Sort command to continue to be accepted and run before it has finished with the first one. Refine should probably return an error of some kind if this happens. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=476_
issues.title: Sort command allows multiple instances to be run

issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (November 04, 2011 15:11:23)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a Refine project with attached UTF-8 encoded text file. 2. In preview, try to use separator char for a "Start of Header" SOH typically expressed in Javascript as \u0001, or \x01, or \ or \' or " etc... What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Refine does not separate using any \ escaped special characters as shown here: http://www.c-point.com/javascript_tutorial/special_characters.htm I also tried unchecking "Quotation marks are used..." and "Parse cell text into numbers, date..." but still no changes with additional columns shown in preview while trying to use various special separator characters. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=475_
issues.title: New Importer does not accept special separator characters completely such as Unicode chars

issues.body:
_Original author: tfmorris (October 29, 2011 22:11:22)_

Specifying a limit for the number of records to be imported has no effect.  From looking at the code, it appears that when it did work, it might have been counting rows instead of records.

This may affect the JSON importer too if the issue is in one of the Tree importer superclasses.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=474_
issues.title: XML importer ignores record limit

issues.title: /en/ ids are being return with match.recon.id instead of a /m/ mid
issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (October 28, 2011 19:36:52)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. reconcile several cells in a column. 2. transform another column with cells["matching"].recon.match.id What is the expected output? What do you see instead? With 2.5 trunk... In some cases, the /en/ identifier is returned, in other cells, the /m/ mid identifier is returned (which appears to be from the use of "search for match" functionality that was supposed to have been previously fixed" _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=472_

_Original author: Paul.Pau...@gmail.com (October 26, 2011 07:28:54)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Doing a reconcile on more than 5000 records 2. Getting 3 suggestions per record to choose from 3. When on page > 1 (recordnr > 50), after having made a choice for a general replace the interface jumps back to the firts page and one has to page again to the place where the last choice has been made to move on to the next choice to be made, which is areal annoyance having more than 100 pages. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=469_
issues.title: Make reconciliation selection sometimes resets position to beginning of project

issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (October 19, 2011 00:28:38)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Get cm12.zip from http://www.fec.gov/finance/disclosure/ftpdet.shtml#a2011_2012 2. Create project from cm12.zip file 3. ZIP file contains only 1 file, foiacm.dta and is not detected. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Do file extensions really matter ? Data publishers use any and all extension forms, like our own USA government. I expected Refine to be uncaring in this regard as a power tool and extract the foiacm.dta file and default to line-based preview. foiacm.dta is not extracted and blank preview shows. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=465_
issues.title: Data text file with extension .dta within a .ZIP is not automatically extracted

issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (October 14, 2011 14:37:50)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. On Windows system, in command console, type C:>refine /? 2. Refine says it cannot find the file specified for some of it's parameters. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Refine should always show the parameters for Windows/Linux/Mac users either with /? or -? depending on OS. Instead, on Windows 7 I see: C:\Users\tguidry\Downloads\Freebase\grefine>refine /? Usage refine [options] <action> where [options] include: Displays messages, or turns command-echoing on or off. ECHO [ON | OFF] ECHO [message] Type ECHO without parameters to display the current echo setting. The system cannot find the file specified. default: 3333 The system cannot find the file specified. default: 127.0.0.1 The system cannot find the file specified. default src\main\webapp /d enable JVM debugging (on port 8000) The system cannot find the file specified. default: 1024M /x enable JMX monitoring (for jconsole and friends) The system cannot find the file specified. build ..................... Build Google Refine run ....................... Run Google Refine clean ..................... Clean compiled classes distclean ................. Remove all generated files _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=463_

_Original author: tfmorris (October 12, 2011 23:44:17)_

The Excel importer is currently trimming leading and trailing whitespace from cells which contain strings.  It shouldn't do that.

issues.body: _Original author: thadguidry (August 25, 2011 17:03:32)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run a Fetch URL for 30 mins. 2. GETS are found in log with saving workspaces (no problems so far) 3. After about 30 mins, a loaded project happens where /core/get and /core/compute operations fire and Fetches stop running. 4. Auto Saving continues to fire and run every 5 mins during the entire sequence and after the Fetches stop running. ## Notice the timing of all of this... on WithActiveFacetOn7000Rows.txt a quick save, then a load from disk with compute-facets (perhaps since I did have a facet open with 7000 rows filtered True? because I was trying to Fetch URLs only on those filtered 7000 rows and not all my rows) then after the compute-facets the whole Fetch/GET process just stopped. Maybe we need an Auto-Save checkmark option in Preferences ? Looking at 127.0.0.1:3333/preferences only allows adding a key value. Do we have have defined for AutoSave = False ? Maybe it's a bigger bug and Auto Saving could/can work with Fetching URLs and I just am unaware ? I tried another Fetch URLs run with NoFacets_Fetching_All_8800_Rows.txt , and the problem occured again, with similar timing events after about 30 mins as well. (Also sent David H. my private MySpace.tsv file to help debug this.) _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=440_

A good default perhaps is to start at a timeout of 1 min on a response ? dunno.

Currently the console shows "status pings" every .5 seconds that do not coincide with expectations for the Throttle delay timing users choose, such as 5000ms or whatever.

(already reported to David via chat, and creating new issue so we don't lose track of this general logging improvement during fetches)

issues.body: _Original author: xco...@gmail.com (June 21, 2011 19:29:21)_ Using extensibly the Fetching URLs from WebServices functionality I have found many problems: incomplete process, aborted operation, etc. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use the "Add Column by fetching URLs..." with 2,000 rows. 2. Invoke any Json API using "value" for input, name the New Column and set Throttle Delay to 2000. 3. Wait for the process to complete ... What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The more common scenarios are: 1) In the process of invoking the Web Services for +2,000 rows, the progress window suddenly closes, and the new Column isn't even created. All the progress is lost (this indeed a big issue when the invokes are calling a paid service). 2) Sometimes the process is completed, but the new Column doesn't show up, a restart for Refine is needed to be able to display the new Column. 3) Sometimes the column is created, but all the cells are empty. 4) Sometimes the process just hangs up, and you need to Cancel the operation (and lost all the progress) At least the possibility to keep all the progress (before the crash) is needed, so you don't lost all the rows that have been invoked. (Maybe this will need a two-step approach, firs creating the Column and then invoking the Web Service) What version of Google Refine are you using? I have tried with 2.0 and 2.1 RC1 What operating system and browser are you using? Mac OSX, Chrome Is this problem specific to the type of browser you're using or it happens in all the browsers you tried? I have tried Firefox 4.x and Chrome 11.x, same behavior. Please provide any additional information below. Using this feature in 1,500 rows or less work great. I have tried setting the Throttle delay to 2000, the default (5000) or longer, sometimes improves the probability that the process completes, but sometimes even with this values the process doesn't work. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/google-refine/issues/detail?id=413_
issues.title: Fetching URLs from Web Services instability
